page.title: 03Crathie Primary School
page.content: The catchment area for our school covers 100 square kilometres. The school was built in 1869. Our school uniform is white shirt or blouse. Boys wear a bottle green tie, both boys and girls wear kilts and bottle green jumpers. In winter we go skiing at Glenshee and we have a ski race when only the fastest skiers go. We have 34 pupils at Crathie, 16 in room 1 and 18 in room 2. Mrs Birss is our head- teacher and our other teacher is Mrs Grigor. We do lots of projects. We have visiting teachers for gym, drama, music, art and sewing. At break we play all sorts of games. In summer we get 6 weeks off school. Sometimes in winter we get snowed in so we have no school. We get homework such as reading or tables. Just now we are having a new extension built on to the school.
